snippet: As the government pursued the scientific mysteries of Friday’s exploding meteor, residents reacted to their survival with giddy relief and humor.
abstract: Russians are still reacting to what NASA scientists say was 7,000-ton chunk of space rock that hurtled out of sky at 40,000 miles an hour, exploding over Ural Mountains and amazingly, killing no one; Russian government pursues scientific mysteries of exploding meteor, sending divers through 20-foot hole and into inky waters of Lake Chebarkul in Siberian wilderness.
lead_paragraph: As the government pursued the scientific mysteries of Friday’s exploding meteor, residents reacted to their survival with giddy relief and humor.

headline.seo: Russians Seek Clues and Count Blessings After Meteor Blast
headline.main: After Assault From the Heavens, Russians Search for Clues and Count Blessings
headline.print_headline: After Assault From the Heavens, Russians Search for Clues and Count Blessings
